questions.question: What will be the output of the following code? console.log(2 + '2');
Which of the following is the correct way to declare a variable in JavaScript?
What is the result of '5' == 5 in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in JavaScript?
Which of the following methods is used to add a new item to the end of an array?
What will be the output of the following code? console.log([] == []);
Which method is used to remove the last item from an array?
What does the 'typeof' operator do?
options: Returns the type of a variable
Checks if a variable is defined
Returns the value of a variable
Returns the length of a variable
questions.correct_answer: Returns the type of a variable

questions.question: Which of the following is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A function that references variables from its outer scope
A function that defines its own variables
A function that takes other functions as arguments
questions.correct_answer: A function that references variables from its outer scope

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct way to create an object in JavaScript?
What will be the result of the following code? console.log(0 == false);
What is the purpose of the 'bind()' method in JavaScript?
options: Creates a new function with a specific 'this' value
questions.correct_answer: Creates a new function with a specific 'this' value

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct way to declare a constant in JavaScript?
What will be the result of the following code? console.log(5 + '5');
Which of the following is the correct syntax for defining an arrow function in JavaScript?
Which of the following methods is used to convert a string to an array?
What will be the output of the following code? console.log('2' + 2);
Which of the following is used to declare a block of code that can be executed repeatedly in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'async' keyword in JavaScript?
options: Defines a function that returns a promise
Defines a function that runs asynchronously
questions.correct_answer: Defines a function that returns a promise

questions.question: Which method is used to add an event listener to an element in JavaScript?
What does the 'localStorage' object do in JavaScript?
options: Stores data on the client-side permanently
questions.correct_answer: Stores data on the client-side permanently

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'setTimeout()' method in JavaScript?
options: Executes a function after a specified delay
Sets a timer to stop the script
Sets a time interval for the function to execute
questions.correct_answer: Executes a function after a specified delay

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct way to declare a function in JavaScript?
What is the purpose of the 'apply()' method in JavaScript?
options: Calls a function with a given 'this' value and arguments
Defines a function with a specific 'this' value
Creates a new array from arguments
questions.correct_answer: Calls a function with a given 'this' value and arguments

What is the output of the following code? console.log([1,2] == [1,2]);
Which method is used to remove the first item from an array in JavaScript?
What is the result of 2 + 3 + '5' in JavaScript?
